title: BadInstruction only in nethermind

body:
Thanks for the answer but unfortunately that didn't work, I found this on the documentation page of Nethermind:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71089247/98919107-bc8aad80-24ce-11eb-8dd6-641ee0c7ebd7.png)

Does this has anything to do with the issue? Btw ecrecover does work

can you call debug.trace on it?

BadInstruction is not related to precompiles -> this can only be a thing like SHL, SHR, CHAINID, and so on.
@Siyuue I plan to work on it from 10am UTC today and hope to get it solved by 11:30 UTC.
on it
delayed, distractions
can't get BadInstruction so far but did not compile your code yet, tried various opcodes so far and checked registered precompiles
I'm using the node within a docker container (the official docker). maybe the docker version ships with a not-so-current version of the node?

@Siyuue I have deployed the compiled code and retrieved the bytecode
The contract uses the (FE - INVALID) instruction which may be invoked in many different paths.

If there is no critical data in your transaction flow then this would help to solve the issue:

1) send the transaction to the chain and then call debug_traceTransaction(txHash, {}) and send the result

or simply send us the exact parameters that you invoke and I can do the same (you can send the rpc call or javascript code that invokes it)

The transaction has this params:
 a: ["0x2edb1888c01439f762471cdf5a0fb4f71786f9347660e6a39f254809650c3553","0x2b4d042cb6dde24d931d4fcc2d424e054455a8543188fb6a2565cb951c95881a"],
 b: [["0x1ed159719f81d5640c70b906c94b4c2c488c6386352c70c23305339a6952380b","0x036b2e8ec0991b7ef64863fc1ed14b019d39eed9dd926a147e0d0dd70c0e61d8"],["0x2925b646d1a5181b29702eb22e0414b3b4963113707215d0376b549bc737abe0","0x2bee9a523e0f4dfb317d5d44d7d85c7fe56a5481008f4b8d595d25e472a8abf1"]],
 c: ["0x05a4b562005f760fe8128e0528ab1ceaa983109d32a81f8815bbf14fd6f53db0","0x18079340228d431e0f6eac1506ea469fc09c9d4b7ea21b5193bda089db887a82"]

And these are the logs of the node:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71089247/99234516-e99fce80-27f4-11eb-8cd9-f25cd2b3b946.png)

Result of calling debug_traceTransaction is this (quite long):
https://file.io/DySPfu1oBIfx (github won't let me paste it here, I've also tried web were I can upload a snippet, but its too long)
thank you @Siyuue !
[Uploading Nethermind Issue 2449.txt]()

@Siyuue you mentioned before the BadInstruction error. Did it disappear after you updated the config? I can see the node is returning REVERT instruction results now. (in the screenshot and the trace file)
let me check

in progress:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/498913/99392082-0dd1dd00-28d3-11eb-9db3-e80307725657.png)

hmmmmm, it returns true for me:

what I did:

1) launched spaceneth (empty)
2) deployed your Verifier.sol contract
3) issued a call (notice I changed the first four bytes of data to replace the shield contract signature with the verifier verifyTx signature):
eth.call({"from" : "0x7e5f4552091a69125d5dfcb7b8c2659029395bdf", "to" : "0xDe09E74d4888Bc4e65F589e8c13Bce9F71DdF4c7", "data" : "", "Gas": 1000000})

Let me try it from empty database, repeating the steps above

PS C:\src\investigation> truffle deploy --network spaceneth

@Siyuue I think it is very unlikely that the verifyTx would return 1 for me if I called anything nonsensical

Would you please provide step by step all the code used and actions taken both in Ganache and in Nethermind? That would be very helpful.

Yep, the trace is from a call to a mocked verifier as I said a couple comments above, my bad.

Here's what we are doing (interaction with remix & deployment on truffle) :

And these are the node logs from the transaction with the params previously mentioned:

```
2020-11-17 15:35:42.4560|Executing JSON RPC call eth_call with params {
  "from": "0x90f8bf6a479f320ead074411a4b0e7944ea8c9c1",
  "to": "0xe78a0f7e598cc8b0bb87894b0f60dd2a88d6a8ab",
  "data": "",
  "value": "0x0",
  "gas": "0x2dc6c0"
},0x2 
2020-11-17 15:35:42.4724|Executing JSON RPC call net_version with params  
2020-11-17 15:35:42.5570|Error when handling ID 3529752737, eth_call({
  "from": "0x90f8bf6a479f320ead074411a4b0e7944ea8c9c1",
  "to": "0xe78a0f7e598cc8b0bb87894b0f60dd2a88d6a8ab",
  "data": "",
  "value": "0x0",
  "gas": "0x2dc6c0"
},0x2) | {"jsonrpc":"2.0","error":{"code":-32015,"message":"VM execution error.","data":"BadInstruction"},"id":3529752737} 
```
And this is the respone we get from remix:
```
call to Verifier.verifyTx
call to Verifier.verifyTx errored: Error: Internal JSON-RPC error. { "code": -32015, "message": "VM execution error.", "data": "BadInstruction" }
```

The same transaction was successfully executed on the JavaScriptVM.
We already tried to do the same with the genesis.json that you gave us but keeps failing.

I'm afraid that i cannot give you any trace of the execution since the node doesn't even store the transaction (not even the receipt).
Are you using the standard Shield contract? (can you confirm the sol code of the shield so I can deplot the same code).

No, I'm not using any Shield contract (calling the verifier directly) since the thing that does not work is the verifier (I'd like to solve that first). The verifier is automatically generated by Zokrates from a circuit.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/498913/99508673-c6a02680-297c-11eb-842f-cf07d133497b.png)

Only when I replace some bytes with I can get a Revert but never BadInstruction:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/498913/99509688-01568e80-297e-11eb-8d4e-054271357adb.png)
which version of Nethermind are you running @Siyuue ?
Could you send Nethermind logs please?
